revised_title: Herschel's Observations of Nebulae and Clusters of Stars
tldr: John Frederick William Herschel conducted observations of nebulae and star clusters using a 20-foot reflector telescope between 1825 and 1833. He discovered around 500 new nebulae, adding to the existing knowledge of celestial objects. His observations provided a more comprehensive understanding of the contents of the northern hemisphere and highlighted the need for more powerful instruments to further explore these mysterious objects.
